page.title: 10SOUTH HYLTON RIVERSIDE
page.content: The banks of the River Wear, once heavily industrialised, now much in dereliction, are slowly being reclaimed, landscaped and turned into a series of riverside parks. In South Hylton industrial sites have been levelled and grass and trees have been planted. In some areas tables and benches have been positioned and footpaths upgraded. The river is tidal and at high tide water sports often take place. There is a rowing club with a clubhouse and slipway on the south bank. The South Hylton Sea Scouts go canoeing or sailing. Power boats use the river for water skiing. There is a slipway outside the Golden Lion public house, itself once a derelict building.There are raft races and a tug of war across the river.
